ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sivaparvathy Cultural Society, a society registered under Travancore Charitable Societies Act ( T 1448/2010) with the objective to promote and sustain cultural, religious, charitable, educational, and literary activities, and to provide a forum for exchanging ideas and views with various national and international organizations of similar interest. Various social programs are held throughout the year to preserve and cultivate our fine and treasured culture and also undertake other activities pertaining to the objectives of the Society, like organizing yearly CHILANKA RURAL FEST , with view to take classical art and dance forms to the rural areas and give local residents and opportunity to familarise with art forms .This will showcase various performances in various forms of art and culture where we intent to rope in famous panel of artist, personalities , celebrities and scholars for make its successful event year after year.. We have affiliations with Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Academy and Kerala Folklore Academy . Society also gives special emphasis to promote National, International and intercultural exchange and cooperation in the cultural and art sphere and pay particular attention the rights of children and youth to culture. As part of this Sivaparvathy cultural society started conducting festivals in association with different Govt and non Govt Organizations like Tourism Department, Govt Of Kerala, Lions clubs International etc , in Rural areas by adding several activities and programmes to promote art and culture in Rural areas.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The members of the society have registred the society named Sneharam Special School for Mentally Retarded vide Reg. No. K 352/02 Two schools are included in the society The schools are governed by a member governing body with Sr Archana Provincial Superior as the president. The body meets at regular intervals and takes sutiable decision for the smooth functioning of the schools and glad to say the management extending all possible physical and monetoring assistance is worth mentioning that type province spend enough money to construct a basket ball court.according to thier intellectual ablities, students are grouped in to pre-primary, primary secondary pre vocational vocational and care group class. Special care taken to prepare the syllabus in such way that the students are utilised top the maximum.There are training prtogames in yoga physical training, stitching, dance, music and bandset etc According to the new rules students above 18 years have to be usefully employed We are providing training to our children according to their taste. we have several units providing vocational to our students some of them are colour making, candle making ornaments phenyl soap powder muffler making The parent of our school meet atleast once every term Parents are conducted as to how they can help their words at home as the contribution of the teaching dine at school One day seminar conducted on 11th February 2015 for parents and siblinngs and co operted with state institute for mentally challanger SIMC Our students participate in various sports and games such as volleyball basket ball,badminton cycling, swimming and atheltics They won several prize and also participated in various competition with the true sprit on the game.We celebrate the festivals like Onam Christmas Childrens DayIndependence Day Annual day and home day We conducted cultural programes the last Friday of every month Every year we conducted a oneday picnic The picnic is wonderful day filled with joy and fun with the children Moreoverr the tour helps thier social conciounes and friendship with nature .Naditha Ramesh participated in Asia Pacific special olimpics in Australia and won bronze medals in 4 100 meter relay and long jump. ngoList.address: Tamton Abdul Azeez Memorial Manas CentreChonankunnu, ThalakulathurCalicut- 673317KERALA- INDIA
ngoList.title: Society For Mental Health Kerala
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: * 1986: The charitable society was established and registered under the inspiring leadership of Sri Tamton Abdul Azeez who was the founder of this centre. He continued as the secretary till his demise in 1995. * 1987: Started a Day Care Centre with a popcorn unit at Mankave (Calicut) with Devasya as the manager who continues till date. It served as a centre of occupation therapy and also as a training centre to enable patients to stand on their own feet. The centre was shifted to puthiyara as the society had to vacate the building. Popcorn and peanuts were marketed initially and a nursery was started and seedlings of nut mugs, cloves etc were grown and sold. The social forestry programmed supported this project. The inmates participated in these ventures participated wholeheartedly. * 1988: Purchased 70 cents of land at Thalakulathur, 12 Km north of Calicut, to house a rehabilitation centre for the mentally ill. The foundation stone for the residential complex was laid by the then Minister of Health Mr.A.C Shanmugadas at the site. * 1990: The Round Table 69 sponsored the construction of the of a building for occupational therapy. Dr. V. Ramachandran, the president of the Indian Psychiatric Society, inaugurated the building. * 1990: Started free monthly medical camps for the mentally ill, which provides them with diagnosis and medicine, free of cost. This is continued without break till date. On the last Thursday of every month medicines are dispensed free and we are grateful to the psychiatrists of Calicut, who attend the camp on their own, allowing free consultation. * 1991: Built the Industrial centre at Thalakulathur site with the financial assistance of Calicut Round Table-69. * 1992: The society organized a seminar on rehabilitation of mental patients and a medical camp in Calicut in which many leading psychiatrists of national stature such as Dr. Mohan Isaac (NIMHANS) and Dr. Raj Kumar (SCARF) participated. The then president of the society Dr. Mohammed Hassan was the organizer of this event * 1993: Undertook the construction of the first stage of Rehabilitation Centre at a cost of Rs 8 Lakhs. In the absence of assistance from the Govt, the society mobilized the entire expenses by way of donations from the public. * 1995: Tamton Abdul Azeez passed away. The members, his family, relatives and friends took the project as a challenge and the first phase of the building at Thalakulathur was completed in 1996 * 1996: The Rehabilitation center was inaugurated and named after Late Tamton Abdul Azeez, was inaugurated by the then Chief Minister of Kerala, Sri A.K Antony * 1998: Foundation stone laid for Northern Block * 1999: The society celebrated the 100th medical camp in Calicut city and the participation of leading psychiatrists of Calicut made it memorable * 2003: The new block of the building was opened with a space of more than 4000 sq.ft * 2004: Concert held in aid of Manas Centre

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Late Dr. Mar Joseph Kundukulam, former Archbishop of Thrissur and the founder director Msgr. Dr. Joseph Vilangadan had the mission and vision to establish a rehabilitation centre for mentally ill people. They had strongly felt that service to the mentally ill people is an integral mission of the society. The institution named St. Joseph mental health care home was started on16th August 1993 to help the poor mentally ill people with empathetic attitude. It was registered as charitable organization under the Travancore-Cochin Literacy, Scientific and charitable Societies Registration Act X11 of 1955[Reg.No.258/94]). At present 126 residents and about 10000 mentally imbalanced persons out side are getting service from this organization belonging to different cast, creed, and religion. Most of the residents are taken to here by the police people characterized by those who wandering on the street and from the existing government mental hospital. Since many of the beneficiaries of this rehabilitation center are orphans and the others from different charitable institutions True to the fact that we could proudly inform you that by the last year, we could improve the quality of care and rehabilitation with systematic approach to our beneficiaries and could help them to lead a life with dignity and respect. We could help the beneficiaries to grow from a feeling of no worth to a feeling of worth; from incompleteness to completeness; from insecurity to security; from irresponsibility to responsibility; from closeness to openness; from no destined to destined; from unloved and unlovable to loved and lovable. We provide emotional security in a loving, kind considerate and warm approach. We help the beneficiaries with empathetic understanding. We strengthen our beneficiariesâ€™ confidence by a favourable and positive attitude. We help the beneficiaries to become realistically aware of their human exigencies. The organization aims to give better treatment, to increase their standard of living, to improve their ability, to empower them to be self reliant in all respects. We help the beneficiaries with empathetic understanding. We strengthen our beneficiariesâ€™ confidence by a favourable and positive attitude. We help the beneficiaries to become realistically aware of their human exigencies. We support our beneficiaries with the following aims ï€¿ to give better treatment ï€¿ to increase their standard of living ï€¿ to improve their ability ï€¿ to give more care & concern ï€¿ to maintain their sense of person ï€¿ to improve their interaction & communication abilities ï€¿ to improve their leadership skills ï€¿ to feel wanted and useful ï€¿ to have their self-esteem boosted ï€¿ to give &receive love ï€¿ to have sense of being respected by self-society and God The organization itself has lot of activities to enable the residents to live meaningfully. According to their ability we formed the whole group into four. Every group has a promoter and group leader. The group members will be changed once in four months. Every day their promoter evaluates the group members individually and they will be given points according to their contribution. The Social Workers make assessment about each and every beneficiary and evaluate their progress both in their behavior and in their mental condition. Each and every individual beneficiary is given personal care and support by personal approach and individual assessment. We look at the abilities of our beneficiaries, not the disabilities. To convert disability into ability we have the activities of vocational training, psychotherapies occupational therapies, celebrations, annual picnic, sports, arts, games, and cultural competitions.
